$!You may need to tell DVLA if you have ischaemic heart disease.$!

%You can be fined up to £1,000 if you don’t tell DVLA about a medical condition that affects your driving. If you’re involved in an accident, you may be prosecuted.%

##Car or motorcycle licence

You don't need to tell DVLA. However, you should check with your doctor before you start driving again.

##Bus, coach or lorry licence

You must tell DVLA. Fill in form VOCH1 and send it to DVLA. The address is on the form.

$D
[Download ‘VOCH1 - Confidential medical information’ (PDF, 394KB)](http://www.direct.gov.uk/prod_consum_dg/groups/dg_digitalassets/@dg/@en/@motor/documents/digitalasset/dg_065302.pdf "Download medical questionnaire"){:rel="external"}
$D

*[DVLA]: Driver Vehicle and Licensing Agency
overview: You must tell DVLA if you have ischaemic heart disease - download the correct form to let them know
title: Ischaemic heart disease and driving
